item.title: While loop, driving me nuts!
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:19, topic:363792”]That’s not what a hypocrite is.
“Hypocrite - A person who acts in contradiction to his or her stated beliefs or feelings”
I did not state anything except about conventions, so unless I break those conventions that I stated, I am not being a hypocrite.[/quote]
But you yourself are breaking conventions. Telling someone else to not break conventions does make you a hypocryte.

Davidi2:

Erm… in this quote you are insinuating that his class has ‘decent design, OO and cohesion’, but has a lower class name.

No, I was giving an example.

Davidi2:

But I do understand what objects are, so you can stop that thought train right there.

Reading through the source of your chat thing v4 says otherwise…

Davidi2:

Now; I’m done replying to this offtopic argument

Giving up?

Read full topic

item.title: While loop, driving me nuts!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

That’s not what a hypocrite is.
“Hypocrite - A person who acts in contradiction to his or her stated beliefs or feelings”
I did not state anything except about conventions, so unless I break those conventions that I stated, I am not being a hypocrite.

“I’d much rather see a class with decent design, object orientation and cohesion with a lowercase class name than something that has been written by someone who doesn’t understand what objects are” Erm… in this quote you are insinuating that his class has ‘decent design, OO and cohesion’, but has a lower class name. But I do understand what objects are, so you can stop that thought train right there.

Now; I’m done replying to this offtopic argument

item.title: While loop, driving me nuts!
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

[quote=“Davidi2, post:17, topic:363792”][quote author=chri5 link=topic=460035.msg3383899#msg3383899 date=1288288066]

[quote author=Davidi2 link=topic=460035.msg3383896#msg3383896 date=1288287863]

Conventions

/facepalm

Class names should be capital
Indent

You’re a hypocrite.
[/quote]searches for my lowercase class names
None found.

That is irrelevant, I’d much rather see a class with decent design, object orientation and cohesion with a lowercase class name than something that has been written by someone who doesn’t understand what objects are.
[/quote]I stated that he needed to fix some conventions, and then you call me a hypocrite. Maybe you do not know what a hypocrite is if you think that my conventions are irrelevant. :o

And if you think that this code shows better OOP than any of my released code, you must be drunk atm…[/quote]

I said that you were a hypocrite since you’re pointing out tiny mistakes when you have large mistakes to deal with yourself.

I didn’t say it did show better “OOP” than any of your released code. Obviously the author deemed it unnecessary to use “OOP” for one reason or another, but you deem it unnecessary to use “OOP” altogether.

Read full topic

item.title: While loop, driving me nuts!
item.dc:creator: @davidi2 Davidi2
item.description:
@davidi2 wrote:

[quote=“usman555, post:9, topic:363792”]Hey I just made this program with GUI.

[code=java]
import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

class appleas{
public static void main(String[] args){
String sides = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(“Enter amount of sides”);
String rolls = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(“Enter amount of rolls”);

	int sides1 = Integer.parseInt(sides);
	int rolls1 = Integer.parseInt(rolls);
	int answer1;
	
    for(int i = 0; i < rolls1; i++){
    answer1 = 0 + misc.random(+sides1);
    
    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You Rolled " +answer1, "the answer", JOptionPane.PLAIN_MESSAGE);
    }
}

}[/code]
Is there a way to make something like this?

If there is, can someone please be kind enough and give me a clue of how to do it?[/quote]Conventions

/facepalm

Class names should be capital
Indent

import javax.swing.JOptionPane;

class appleas{
public static void main(String[] args){
String sides = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(“Enter amount of sides”);
String rolls = JOptionPane.showInputDialog(“Enter amount of rolls”);

	int sides1 = Integer.parseInt(sides);
	int rolls1 = Integer.parseInt(rolls);
	int answer1;
	
    for(int i = 0; i < rolls1; i++){
    answer1 = 0 + misc.random(+sides1);
    
    JOptionPane.showMessageDialog(null, "You Rolled " +answer1, "the answer", JOptionPane.PLAIN_MESSAGE);
    }
}

}[/code]
Is there a way to make something like this?

If there is, can someone please be kind enough and give me a clue of how to do it?

item.title: While loop, driving me nuts!
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

               for(int i = 0; i < rolls; i++){
                answer1 = 0 + misc.random(+sides);
                System.out.println(answer1);
                }

It’s how i would do it, although some may argue that a while loop would be better.

If you can’t do something like this successfully I strongly advise you to re-read some basics about java or in fact programming in general. It’s basic knowledge to know that (x <= x) will always return true.

item.title: While loop, driving me nuts!
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

Hi guys, so I wanted to make a small dice game, but when I added a while loop, it just KEEPS ON REPEATING THE GAME over and over again.
How to play:
You have to enter how many sides you would like the dice to have. Then you enter how many times you want it to roll.
Here is my code:

[code=java]
import java.util.Scanner;

class appleas{
public static void main(String[] args){
Scanner input = new Scanner(System.in);
double rolls, sides, answer1;
System.out.println(“How many sides?”);
sides = input.nextDouble();
System.out.println(“How many rolls?”);
rolls = input.nextDouble();
while (rolls <= rolls){
answer1 = 0 + misc.random(+sides);
System.out.println(answer1);
rolls += 1;
}
}
}[/code]
The problem is that when I enter lets say “5” rolls for the dice, it will keep on repeating the dice rolls.
Like this:
10.0
15.0
17.0
2.0
7.0
19.0
When it’s supposed to only print out the result 5 times.
Is there any way I can make it so it only prints out the times I want it to print out?
Thanks

Read full topic
